doc.field: The speeches and appearances subseries consists of 13 linear feet of materials related to speeches and appearances made by Brademas, including preparatory notes, outlines, drafts, and transcripts of given speeches. In addition to the texts of the speeches, research material used in the writing of the speeches figures prominently in the subseries, primarily in the form of articles from newspapers, magazines, governmental publications, and scholarly journals. Speeches delivered include testimony and statements in Congress, appearances made at meetings and special events of various organizations, societies, universities, and conferences. Transcripts of speeches made on radio or television are also included here. Each speech or appearance is filed separately, with additional folders dedicated to speech material on a specific subject. The folders are organized chronologically, and those speeches without both dates and titles have been filed in an "Unidentified speeches and speech materials" folder at the end. There is an index of speeches and articles made by Brademas' office from 1952 to 1978, although this list appears to be incomplete.
